intro: Plagiogyria triquetra, commonly known as the three-cornered leek, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Plagiogyria triquetra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a long history of use in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
